Class ChocoConsistencyChecker

java.lang.Object

IConsistencyChecker
public class ChocoConsistencyChecker extends Object implements IConsistencyChecker
A consistency checker implementation using the Choco solver

    • isConsistent

      public boolean isConsistent(@NonNull @NonNull ITestCase testcase, @NonNull @NonNull ITestCase neg_testcase)
      consistent(tα ∧ ¬tγ) Checks the consistency between two test cases (tα ∧ ¬tγ) to identify a redundant test case. If the output is false (inconsistent), then tγ is a redundant test case. Used by WipeOutR_T algorithm
      Specified by:
      isConsistent in interface IConsistencyChecker
      Parameters:
      testcase - a ITestCase
      neg_testcase - a ITestCase
      Returns:
      true if the given test cases are not contradict, and false otherwise.

    • isConsistent

      public boolean isConsistent(@NonNull @NonNull Collection<Constraint> C, @NonNull @NonNull Constraint cstr)
      consistent(C - {cstr} ∪ {¬cstr}) Checks the consistency of (C - {cstr} ∪ {¬cstr}) to identify the redundant constraints. If the output is false (inconsistent), then cstr is a redundant constraint. Used by WipeOutR_FM algorithm.
      Specified by:
      isConsistent in interface IConsistencyChecker
      Parameters:
      C - set of Constraints
      cstr - a Constraint
      Returns:
      true if the given test cases are not contradict, and false otherwise.

    • isConsistent

      @Deprecated public boolean isConsistent(@NonNull @NonNull Collection<Constraint> C, @NonNull @NonNull Collection<ITestCase> TC, @NonNull @NonNull Collection<ITestCase> TCp)
      Deprecated.
      Checks the consistency of a set of constraints with a set of test cases. This function returns true if every test case in is consistent with the given set of constraints , otherwise false. Test cases inducing an inconsistency with are stored in . Note that at the beginning, TC = TCp. Used by DirectDebug, TestHSDAG...
      Parameters:
      C - a set of Constraints
      TC - considering ITestCases
      TCp - remaining inconsistent ITestCases
      Returns:
      true if every test case in is consistent with the given set of constraints , otherwise false.

    • isConsistent

      public Set<ITestCase> isConsistent(@NonNull @NonNull Collection<Constraint> C, @NonNull @NonNull Collection<ITestCase> TC, boolean onlyOne)
      Checks the consistency of a set of constraints with a set of test cases, and returns remaining inconsistent ITestCases. Used by DirectDebug, TestHSDAG...
      Specified by:
      isConsistent in interface IConsistencyChecker
      Parameters:
      C - a set of Constraints
      TC - a considering ITestCases
      onlyOne - true - to get only one inconsistent test case, false - to get all inconsistent test cases
      Returns:
      remaining inconsistent ITestCases.
